Oregon soccer suffered its second consecutive loss in its match Sunday morning against No PERIOD 16ranked Cal in Berkeley California PERIOD The Ducks are now  PERIOD For Cal the victory marks its fifth shutout in a row PERIOD

Back and forth play throughout the first half concluded at halftime when the sides remained deadlocked at  PERIOD Oregon goalkeeper Halla Hinriksdottir had a big save midway through the first half to help keep the game scoreless through  minutes PERIOD

In the second half Cal came out firing and the Ducks defense simply could not adapt to the strategy adjustments made by the Golden Bears head coach Neil McGuire PERIOD Cal would score all three of their goals in an 11minute span PERIOD

The first came just eigth minutes after the start of the second half from sophomore forward Abi Kim helping the Golden Bears take the lead and increase Kims season total to seven PERIOD The goal came off of a wellplaced assist from Kelly Fitzgerald before it was drilled into the bottom left area of the net PERIOD

Five minutes later Cal converted on a corner kick from the right side PERIOD After the ball was played in it took multiple deflections before landing over the chest of junior Miranda Nild and was drilled into the net with her left foot PERIOD

Cals offensive serge would not stop there as Mia Corbin joined in on the scoring in the sixty-third minute with a goal of her own extending the Golden Bears lead to three PERIOD

After the goals Hinriksdottir was subbed out for sophomore Kaetlyn Carter PERIOD

The Cal Golden Bears record is now  putting them one game back from the nations No PERIOD 2ranked UCLA which sits third in Pac12 PERIOD

As for Oregon they now prepare to play the only team still below them in the Pac12 standings Utah PERIOD The Ducks square off against the Utes on Thurs. oct PERIOD  at  p.m PERIOD PT in Eugene PERIOD
